items.content_text: Iâ€™ve been inspired by [Rachel Roddy](https://www.theguardian.com/profile/rachel-roddy) this week. Some delicious results. On Tuesday I cooked her recipe for [broad bean, potato and fennel soup](https://www.theguardian.com/food/2023/feb/27/broad-bean-potato-and-fennel-soup-recipe-rachel-roddy) which provided two evening meals. Then yesterday I made a Romanian [apple and caraway loaf cake](https://www.theguardian.com/food/2023/feb/20/apple-caraway-loaf-cake-recipe-rachel-roddy-irina-georgescu), her selection from Irina Georgescuâ€™s book _Tava_.

items.title: St Elvan's Church, Aberdare
items.content_html:
Visited the recently renovated St Elvan’s Church this morning. Very impressive, with the benefit of now having an good in-house coffee shop (just visible off to the right hand side in the first picture) serving very good coffee â˜•

Founded in 1852 and located in the heart of the town of Aberdare, in the picturesque Cynon Valley, St Elvan’s has recently undergone an extensive Â£2 million renovation, and has now reopened as a vibrant new space featuring concert and conference facilities, an exhibition gallery, meeting rooms, heritage tours, our in-house coffee shop “Spires” and of course as a continued active place of worship.
items.content_text: Visited the recently renovated [St Elvan's Church](https://www.stelvans.com) this morning. items.title: Xmas Dinner 2022
items.content_html:
I know Iâ€™m composing this post a few days late, on the morning of New Yearâ€™s Eve, 31st December 2022, but for my reference I do want a record of the food I cooked for this yearâ€™s Christmas dinner.

Most years I cook Christmas dinner around a specific theme (often a nationality) or from a particular (often new) cookery book. This year our meal was based on Afro Vegan: Family recipes from a British-Nigerian kitchen by Zoe Alakija.

Starters were

  • Lebanese-Nigerian Roast Chickpea Shawarma
  • Smoky Cashew and Beetroot Dip

and mains

  • Classic Jollof Rice
  • Groundnut Stew with Sweet Potato
  • Efo Riro (Stewed Greens)
  • Suya-Battered Vegetable Kebabs
  • Eba

The only slight disappointment was the eba - small starchy balls of dough made from garri flour (cassava). Iâ€™d never cooked with the flour before and think I got the consistency wrong - too soft and sticky.

Cooking all that was a lot of work for a relaxed family meal for just the four of us. We certainly didnâ€™t eat everything - leftovers were contributed to a much larger Boxing Day family meal at my brother-in-lawâ€™s farm.

This was the first time I’d cooked from Afro Vegan - I will certainly be trying out more recipes from it.
items.content_text: I know Iâ€™m composing this post a few days late, on the morning of New Yearâ€™s Eve, 31st December 2022, but for my reference I do want a record of the food I cooked for this yearâ€™s Christmas dinner. Most years I cook Christmas dinner around a specific theme (often a nationality) or from a particular (often new) cookery book. This year our meal was based on [Afro Vegan: Family recipes from a British-Nigerian kitchen](https://amzn.to/3CdKTMg) by Zoe Alakija. Starters were - Lebanese-Nigerian Roast Chickpea Shawarma - Smoky Cashew and Beetroot Dip and mains - Classic Jollof Rice - Groundnut Stew with Sweet Potato - Efo Riro (Stewed Greens) - Suya-Battered Vegetable Kebabs - [Eba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eba) The only slight disappointment was the eba - small starchy balls of dough made from garri flour (cassava). Iâ€™d never cooked with the flour before and think I got the consistency wrong - too soft and sticky. Cooking all that was a lot of work for a relaxed family meal for just the four of us. We certainly didnâ€™t eat everything - leftovers were contributed to a much larger Boxing Day family meal at my brother-in-lawâ€™s farm. This was the first time I'd cooked from _Afro Vegan_ - I will certainly be trying out more recipes from it.

items.title: Heartsease ğŸ¥€ğŸ¤”: On Heartsease
items.content_html:
Heartsease is â€‹Viola tricolorâ€‹, a common European wild flower also known as wild pansy.

D .H. Lawrence titled a collection of poems â€‹Pansiesâ€‹, titled partly as a pun on the French word â€‹pensÃ©esâ€‹, translated as â€‹thoughtsâ€‹.

The dictionary definition of heartsease is contentment and tranquility.

Iâ€™m going to use the word heartsease to classify a series of journal entries and blog posts.

My idea is to post frequently on any idea that is preoccupying or interesting me at the time, with an attempt to compose at least 100 words, however fragmentary those words may be. My aim is to develop the habit of making regular and longer posts.
items.content_text:
Heartsease is â€‹*Viola tricolor*â€‹, a common European wild flower also known as wild pansy. 

D .H. Lawrence titled a collection of poems â€‹*Pansies*â€‹, titled partly as a pun on the French word â€‹*pensÃ©es*â€‹, translated as â€‹*thoughts*â€‹.

The dictionary definition of heartsease is contentment and tranquility.

Iâ€™m going to use the word **heartsease** to classify a series of journal entries and blog posts. 

My idea is to post frequently on any idea that is preoccupying or interesting me at the time, with an attempt to compose at least 100 words, however fragmentary those words may be. My aim is to develop the habit of making regular and longer posts.

items.content_text:
Donâ€™t view with the expectation that the film will fairly represent the books of the Alexandria Quartet. Mixed up and confused, but recognisable characters, scenes and lines from Durrellâ€™s work. Missing and distorting so much but I did enjoy the experience - not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest!

The film is visually impressive (in parts excessive in a late 1960s way) and quite atmospheric. The performances of Dirk Bogarde, Michael York, Anouk AimÃ©e, Anna Karina and others are worth seeing.

On the negative side the quality of the DVD transfer I watched was terrible ğŸ˜

British politics does not offer much more cause for optimism. Liz Truss becoming prime minister is â€œsuch a disasterâ€, he says. â€œSheâ€™s intellectually so vapid. I think her world-view is so tiny, so shrivelled, so ungenerous, so dryâ€¦ Or maybe sheâ€™s just a highly ambitious politician whoâ€™s playing a very cynical game.â€ He sees an opportunity for Keir Starmerâ€™s Labour â€“ â€œI admire him in many waysâ€ â€“ but for McEwan, an ardent Remainer who wrote a satirical novella, The Cockroach, about Brexit, the Labour leader remains â€œtied to the Toriesâ€ until he â€œadmits Brexit was a colossal errorâ€.

Today we decided it was about time we had lunch at the tiny Thai restaurant in our local market hall

The food is prepared in the small kitchen right in front of the four customer tables

Studying the menu board

Dishes from front to back - Prawn Pad Thai, Tofu Pad Siew and Tofu Pad Mama, accompanied by Thai prawn crackers and spring rolls

Everything was really delicious - but a special mention goes to the Pad Thai, which was fantastic ğŸğŸ˜‹

I’m certain we will be eating there again.

items.content_html:
Went to my first Hundred cricket match yesterday, Welsh Fire v Oval Invincibles at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Welsh Fire lost by 39 runs; their batting was poor and the bowling of the Curran brothers and Sunil Narine too good. Enjoyed seeing the match but Iâ€™m still not convinced of the need for this new format of the game ğŸ

Photo is of Tom Curran bowling to Ollie Pope.

items.content_html:
From the comments to that last linked article on wasps:

Bees were once wasps but diverged from them during the Cretacious period when flowering plants appeared in nature. In effect, they made peace with the natural world choosing a diet of flower pollen over that of their former hunter scavenger selves. The beginnings of ‘flower power’. Peace to the bees.

ğŸ

First attempt at a self-portrait - not flattering, but some would say fairly accurate ğŸ˜‰

prompt: seated grey haired man with a bushy grey beard drinks a glass of red wine and reads a green book

The area I live in - not badâ€¦

prompt: Cynon valley in Wales

…and a more specific location even closer to home - I wish, but a bit overdramatic!

prompt: Werfa Abernant

items.content_text:
A lot darker than I remember the 1970s/1980s TV series ğŸ˜ŠÂ 

And I thought it was a lot better than all the bad reviews here would suggest. Competent tongue-in-cheek horror which reminded me of some old Amicus/Hammer films and the 1980s HouseÂ  series of films (which I also likedâ€¦).

Overall it kept me interested and wanting to know where the story and characters went. Enjoyed!

items.content_html:
I have just updated my Micro.blog Navigation List plug-in to version 1.0.6

Prior to this version a link to the list page was automatically added to the site’s main navigation menu. This is no longer the case.

So, if you do want the link to appear in your site’s main menu when the plug-in has been installed see the instructions in the GitHub README.
